title: Orla O'Donnell
text:
Orla O'Donnell is an Irish journalist. She is Legal Affairs Correspondent for <a href="RT%C3%89%20News%20and%20Current%20Affairs">RTÉ News</a> and presents "Finné", <a href="TG4">TG4</a>'s <a href="documentary%20series">documentary series</a>. She previously was <a href="Galway">Galway</a> and <a href="Dublin">Dublin</a> correspondent for <a href="TG4">TG4</a> from 1996 to 1999.
Career.
From <a href="Dalkey">Dalkey</a>, <a href="County%20Dublin">County Dublin</a>, O'Donnell started her career as a reporter and correspondent for <a href="TG4">TG4</a> from July 1996 to June 1999. She joined <a href="Raidi%C3%B3%20Teilif%C3%ADs%20%C3%89ireann">Raidió Teilifís Éireann</a> (RTÉ) in June 1999 and has appeared on RTÉ's main <a href="RT%C3%89%20News%20and%20Current%20Affairs">news</a> programmes, in both <a href="RT%C3%89%20Television">television</a> and <a href="RT%C3%89%20Radio">radio</a>, almost daily for over two decades. She became Dublin Correspondent for RTÉ from June 2003 to July 2006 and since July 2006, O'Donnell is Legal Affairs Correspondent for RTÉ News.
Since 5 September 2018, O'Donnell presents <a href="TG4">TG4</a>'s <a href="crime">crime</a> <a href="documentary%20series">documentary series</a>, "Finné", which focuses on Irish news stories that have made <a href="headline">headline</a>s over the last 50 years.
O'Donnell has been reporting on the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 crisis</a> for <a href="RT%C3%89%20News%20and%20Current%20Affairs">RTÉ News</a> since the pandemic reached <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20the%20Republic%20of%20Ireland">Ireland</a>.
